Standard_Text: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal contrast, addition, and other logical relationships (e.g., however, although, nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in addition).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand each of the words.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Interpret figurative language, including similes and metaphors, in context.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Compare and contrast the varieties of English (e.g., dialects, registers) used in stories, dramas, or poems.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Knowledge of Language
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use underlining, quotation marks, or italics to indicate titles of works.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use a comma to set off the words yes and no (e.g., Yes, thank you), to set off a tag question from the rest of the sentence (e.g., It's true, isn't it?), and to indicate direct address (e.g., Is that you, Steve?).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use a comma to separate an introductory element from the rest of the sentence.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use punctuation to separate items in a series.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use correlative conjunctions (e.g., either/or, neither/nor).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use verb tense to convey various times, sequences, states, and conditions.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Form and use the perfect (e.g., I had walked; I have walked; I will have walked) verb tenses.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Explain the function of conjunctions, prepositions, and interjections in general and their function in particular sentences.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Conventions of Standard English
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Language Standards
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Knowledge of Language
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Conventions of Standard English
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal English when appropriate to task and situation.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, sound) and visual displays in presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Report on a topic or text or present an opinion, sequencing ideas logically and using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Summarize the points a speaker makes and explain how each claim is supported by reasons and evidence.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Summarize a written text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Review the key ideas expressed and draw conclusions in light of information and knowledge gained from the discussions.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Pose and respond to specific questions by making comments that contribute to the discussion and elaborate on the remarks of others.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 5 topics and texts, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Comprehension and Collaboration
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Speaking and Listening Standards
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Comprehension and Collaboration
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Range of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Apply grade 5 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., "Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point[s]").
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Apply grade 5 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or a drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., how characters interact]").
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; summarize or paraphrase information in notes and finished work, and provide a list of sources.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Conduct short research projects that use several sources to build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of two pages in a single sitting.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Production and Distribution of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use a variety of transitional words, phrases, and clauses to manage the sequence of events.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, description, and pacing, to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Link ideas within and across categories of information using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., in contrast, especially).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Introduce a topic clearly, provide a general observation and focus, and group related information logically; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Link opinion and reasons using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., consequently, specifically).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Provide logically ordered reasons that are supported by facts and details.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer's purpose.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Text Types and Purposes
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Writing Standards
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Range of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Production and Distribution of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Text Types and Purposes
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Read on-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Fluency
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology (e.g., roots and affixes) to read accurately unfamiliar multisyllabic words in context and out of context.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Phonics and Word Recognition
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Reading Standards: Foundational Skills
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, at the high end of the grades 4—5 text complexity band independently and proficiently.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point(s).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Draw on information from multiple print or digital sources, demonstrating the ability to locate an answer to a question quickly or to solve a problem efficiently.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and differences in the point of view they represent.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in two or more texts.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or subject area.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Determine two or more main ideas of a text and explain how they are supported by key details; summarize the text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Key Ideas and Details
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Reading Standards for Informational Text
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of the grades 4—5 text complexity band independently and proficiently.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes and topics.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning, tone, or beauty of a text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Describe how a narrator's or speaker's point of view influences how events are described.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits together to provide the overall structure of a particular story, drama, or poem.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and similes.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how characters interact).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic; summarize the text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Key Ideas and Details
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Reading Standards for Literature
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
Subject: English Language Arts
